list_definition.definition: in playing cards, some competitions etc, a fund of prize-money that goes on increasing until it is won

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: What are the chances of winning the jackpot?

list_ex_of_english: The jackpots begin at $1,000,000 (all-cash, and taxes-paid), increasing by at least $50,000 if there is no top prize winner.
Players of the 6/44 paid $1 per game; its jackpots began at $5 million.
Furthermore, if one of the numbers were out of sequence, the unrefundable ticket could not reach the jackpot and can't be refunded and would be worth nothing.
Jackpots begin at $15,000,000 with minimum rollovers of $5,000,000.
The jackpots begin at $1,000,000 (all-cash; and taxes-paid), increasing by at least $50,000 if there is no top prize winner.
I always thought that jackpots came with gambling machines.
The jackpot's credibility will become slightly soiled when the sums are enormous.
There are 6 arcades, each with its own 18-only section with high jackpots.
